page.title: 13Entertainment in Cheadle
page.content: The earliest form of entertainment in Cheadle took place in a large tent in the Market Place,where people watched singers,mimics & jugglers.Later the Drama & Choral Societies combined to produce large scale Concerts to celebrate events of local or national importance.There were once several Cinemas in Cheadle which were later converted to Bingo Halls but they did not have lasting appeal.Nowadays people mainly watch T.V.or Videos in their own homes or travel to Hanley to the Cinema or the Theatre.The Gilbert & Sullivan Society (Producer- -Mr.A.Gilbert)has been in existence since 1948 & this year's production 'Oklahoma' was well supported.There is a flourishing Dramatic Society. Productions take place at the Painsley School & Cheadle High Lecture Theatre as cheadle does not have a Theatre.
